column3: Latest;Phnom Penh: The Ministry of Health announced on August 10
column5: that it has found 3 more cases of COVID-19 imported from Indonesia. Two more patients were also treated and have left hosptal.------The recent detected cases were in two men aged 26
column6: and another aged 23. All are from Tbong Khmum province.------The ministry said the three men were passengers from Indonesia on a flight to Cambodia on July 23
column7: 2020. They were sent to Tbong Khmum Provincial Referral Hospital on August 4
column8: 2020 and a fourth test on the 13th day of their isolation came back as positive.------All three patients are currently being treated at Norodom Sihanouk Referral Hospital in Tbong Khmum
column10: those who were treated include: 28-year-old man from Phnom Penh and a 32-year-old man from Battambang province.------The two men
column11: who were passengers on a flight from Russia received two negative test results and were allowed to leave Chak Angre Center.
